meanings.definition: A sign of what will happen in the future; an omen.
meanings.sent1: Seeing a black cat cross your path is considered an augury of bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The sudden rainstorm was seen as an augury of a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: Finding a four-leaf clover could be an augury of winning the lottery!
meanings.sent4: The howling of wolves at night was an eerie augury of danger approaching.
meanings.sent5: The old man's cryptic words served as an augury of impending doom.

meanings.definition: The practice of interpreting omens or signs.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, augury was often used to predict the outcomes of battles.
meanings.sent2: The priestess specialized in the art of augury, reading the flight patterns of birds.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game of augury, trying to predict who would win the race.
meanings.sent4: Her knack for augury was so accurate, she was sought after for advice by many.
meanings.sent5: The king relied on the council of seers skilled in the art of augury.
